title: Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial: Park Home
body: "There I Grew Up..."  A. Lincoln  Abraham Lincoln grew from youth to manhood on this southern Indiana soil.  Many character and moral traits of one of the world's most respected leaders was formed and nurtured here.  Explore Lincoln's boyhood and learn about the boy who would one day become the leader of our nation.              Re-created 1820s homestead   The homestead is typical of the of the 1820s.  It is located on four of the original 160 acres owned by Thomas Lincoln.             Nancy Hanks Lincoln Gravesite   In 1879, Peter Studebaker donated $50 for this tombstone to mark the location of Abraham Lincoln's mother's grave.        Memorial Building with Sculptured Panels   The Memorial Building is Indiana's effort to memorialize Abraham Lincoln.  Completed in 1943, it was built in the spirit of Indiana in 1816.
